premise_source_doc_sentence: Mac OS X 10.4 Tiger was succeeded by Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard on October 26 , 2007 , after 30 months , making Mac OS 10.4 Tiger the longest running version of Mac OS X .
This allows Mac OS X to be installed on certain Mac models which could otherwise only run System 7 , Mac OS 8 or Mac OS 9 , albeit sometimes with incomplete functionality .

Despite not having received security updates since then , Mac OS X 10.4 Tiger remains popular with Power Mac users and retrocomputing enthusiasts due to its wide software and hardware compatibility , as it runs on a wide variety of older machines and is the last Mac OS X version that supports the Classic Environment , a Mac OS 9 compatibility layer .

It also allows more recent versions of Mac OS X to be installed on older G3 Macs which can only officially run earlier versions of OS X - for example , it allows Mac OS X v10 .3 and Mac OS X v10 .4 to run successfully on Beige G3s , 10.2 having been the last version supported by Apple .
XPostFacto - often referred to as `` XPF '' - runs under Mac OS 9 and allows an unmodified Mac OS X installation disc to be launched on machines which can not boot Mac OS X unaided .
